‍RID.Definition: to remove or throw away something unwanted

‍RIGHT UP YOUR STREET.Definition: to be the type of thing that you are interested in or that you enjoy doing

‍DISCIPLINE.Definition: a particular area of study, especially a subject studied at a college or university

‍TRICKY.Definition: if a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill

‍BONUS.Definition: extraGenders: masculine, feminine, or neutral (with respect to language)

‍CONJUGATIONS.Definition: the complete set of grammatical forms of a verb

‍DISCOURAGED.Definition: having lost your confidence or enthusiasm for something

‍HEADS DOWN.Definition: concentrating, usually so heavily and for so long that everything outside the focus area is missed

‍MASOCHIST.Definition: a person who gets (sexual) pleasure from being hurt or controlled by another person

‍CLASSIFY.Definition: to divide things or people into groups according to their type, or to say which group or type something or someone belongs to

‍CONJUGATED.Definition: If a verb conjugates, it has different forms that show different tenses, the number of people it refers to, etc., and if you conjugate a verb, you list its different forms

GIST.Definition: the most important pieces of information about something, or general information without details

‍CORE.Definition: the basic and most important part of something

‍INTERACTION.Definition: a situation where two or more people or things communicate with each other or react to each other

‍HATS OFF TO YOU.Definition: said to praise and thank someone for doing something helpful

‍IMMERSIVE.Definition: surrounded by something, e.g. a language

‍ENROLL.Definition: to put yourself or someone else on an official list for an activity or for membership in a group, or to accept someone in such a list

‍HATE ON.Definition: to criticize someone or say bad things about them, in an unpleasant and public way

‍KUDOS.Definition: the public admiration that a person receives as a result of a particular achievement or position in society

‍DEDICATE.Definition: to give all of your energy, time, etc.

‍POSTPONE.Definition: to delay an event and plan or decide that it should happen at a later date or time

‍SKIP.Definition: to not do or not have something that you usually do or that you should do; to avoid

‍CHORE.Definition: a job or piece of work that is often boring or unpleasant but needs to be done regularly

‍VICIOUS CIRCLE.Definition: a continuing unpleasant situation, created when one problem causes another problem that then makes the first problem worse

‍SLOT.Definition: an amount of time that is officially allowed for a single event in a planned order of activities or events

‍ROUTINE.Definition: a usual or fixed way of doing things

‍AMBITIOUS.Definition: having a strong wish to be successful, powerful, or rich

‍MOTIVATE.Definition: to make someone want to do something well

‍ANNOTATE.Definition: to add notes or remarks on a piece of writing

‍FLOWING.Definition: produced in a smooth, continuous, or relaxed style

‍ELABORATE.Definition: to add more information to or explain something that you have said

‍DISHEARTENED.Definition: having lost confidence, hope, and energy

‍ROLLER COASTER.Definition: a situation which changes from one extreme to another, or in which a person's feelings change from one extreme to another

‍UPHILL.Definition: needing a large amount of effort

‍INTERLUDE.Definition: a short period when a situation or activity is different from what comes before and after it

‍POINTLESS.Definition: something that is pointless has no purpose, and it is a waste of time doing it
